text: Nimdih railway station is a railway station on Purulia-Tatanagar line of Adra railway division of Indian Railway's South Eastern Railway zone. It is situated beside National Highway 32 at Nimdih in Seraikela Kharsawan district in the Indian state of Jharkhand. Total 12 trains stop at Nimdih railway station. ==History== The Bengal Nagpur Railway was formed in 1887 for the purpose of upgrading the Nagpur Chhattisgarh Railway. Purulia-Chakradharpur rail line was opened on 22 January 1890. The Purulia-Chakradharpur rout including Nimdih railway station was electrified in 1961-62. ==References== Category:Adra railway division Category:Railway stations in Seraikela Kharsawan district Category:1890 establishments in India
